Event.0: Prophet Muhammad sets out with his army towards Mecca, capturing it bloodlessly
Event.1: BC The Julian calendar takes effect for the first time
Event.2: King Ataulf of Narbonne marries emperor Honorius sister Galle Placidia
Event.3: The Oprah Winfrey Network (OWN) debuted on television.
Event.4:
Euro introduced in Europe
On this day in 2002 the euro, the monetary unit of the European Union, was introduced with the issuance of both currency and coins, and by March 2002 it was the sole legal tender of participating member states.
Event.5: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) went into effect, eliminating most tariffs and other trade barriers on products and services passing between the United States, Canada, and Mexico.
Event.6: Johnny Cash plays first of many free concerts behind bars
Event.7: Dictator Fulgencio Batista fled Cuba after his regime was toppled by rebel forces led by Fidel Castro.
Event.8: European Economic Community, better known as the European Common Market starts operation
Event.9:
Christine Lagarde
French lawyer and politician
was born
Event.10: The first TV detector van, used to track down users of unlicensed television sets, begins operation in the UK
Event.11: American country-and-western musician Hank Williams, Sr., died.
Event.12:
J.D. Salinger
American author
was born
Event.13: American author J.D. Salinger—whose only novel, The Catcher in the Rye (1951), won wide critical acclaim—was born.
Event.14: Barry M. Goldwater, U.S. senator from Arizona (1953–64, 1969–87) who was the Republican presidential candidate in 1964, was born.
Event.15:
Barry Goldwater
United States senator
was born
Event.16: 1st Rose Bowl, Tournament Park, Pasadena, California: Michigan beats Stanford, 49-0; MVP: Neil Snow, Michigan, FB
Event.17: German physicist Wilhelm Röntgen announces his discovery of x-rays
Event.18: U.S. government official J. Edgar Hoover—who, as director of the FBI (1924–72), built the agency into a highly effective, if occasionally controversial, arm of federal law enforcement—was born.
Event.19:
J. Edgar Hoover
United States government official
was born
Event.20: Ellis Island opens as a US immigration inspection station - it would go on to be the gateway for more than 12 million people
Event.21: Emancipation Proclamation issued by Abraham Lincoln to free slaves in US confederate states
Event.22: The Emancipation Proclamation, which freed the slaves in the Confederacy (the states in rebellion against the Union during the American Civil War), was issued by U.S. President Abraham Lincoln.
Event.23: Writer James Fenimore Cooper (21) weds Susan Augusta de Lancey in Mamaroneck, New York
Event.24: Haiti declared its independence from France.
Event.25: US founding father Thomas Jefferson (30) marries Martha Wayles Skelton (23)
Event.26: The International Commission on Zoological Nomenclature establish the "starting point" for standardized species names across the animal kingdom, based on the binomial nomenclature by Carolus Linnaeus 10th edition of Systema Naturae
Event.27: Paul Revere, the horseback-riding folk hero of the American Revolution, was born.
Event.28:
Paul Revere
United States military officer and silversmith
was born
Event.29: Florentine statesman, ruler, and patron of arts and letters Lorenzo de' Medici was born.
